thread.title: SF election agent's car torched by masked men in Bangor | UTV - ITV News
thread.title_full: SF election agent's car torched by masked men in Bangor | UTV - ITV News

title: SF election agent's car torched by masked men in Bangor | UTV - ITV News
text:
21 February 2017 at 9:37am SF election agent's car torched by masked men in Bangor 
A car belonging to a Sinn Féin election agent has been set on fire in an arson attack in Bangor. 
Police say the vehicle, a black Citroen C4 Picasso, had its windows smashed and a petrol bomb thrown inside, while it was parked in the Towerview Crescent area. 
The attack happened at around 10.30pm on Monday evening. 
Two masked males were seen nearby at the time. 
Police have appealed for information and say they are treating the incident as a hate crime. 
Responding to news of the attack, Sinn Féin leader Michelle O'Neill said, "This is an attack on the democratic process but it will not deter the local candidate or anyone else in Sinn Féin. 
"There are clearly those who are intent on turning this into a brutal campaign and sectarianising the election. 
"I am calling on all party leaders to condemn this attack on democracy and send a clear message to those responsible that this will not be tolerated". Last updated Tue 21 Feb 2017
